reviews.text: My friend & I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Queens Head for a girlie weekend.
reviews.title: Great Little Inn

reviews.text: The staff, Bev, Jamie & team were all very helpful & friendly.
reviews.title: A fantastic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent and they even had a cheeky little white rioja, which we very much enjoyed. The rooms are of a good size and are clean and welcoming.
reviews.title: Superb food, and second to none service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel/pub for a nice relaxing get away.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I met two very dear friends, at the hotel. Bev and Jamie made us welcome the minute we got to the hotel, nothing was too much trouble for them. The meals cooked by a chef, were really tasty, with a good choice of menu. The rooms are comfy and clean, in fact the whole place is spotless.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Queens head on a Saturday night, when we arrived greeted by Keirnan who we would latter realise basically acts as reception/waiter/bar tender/manager for the whole place!!!
reviews.title: Generally Good B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fine clean, tidy and well presented and the shower was great! The rooms were small but then it is an 18th Century building!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On approaching the hotel we were worried we had made a huge mistake. We'd had a nightmare journey trying to navigate through Bedford (must ask Santa for a SatNav next year). The hotel seemed in the middle of nowhere and situated on a busy main road. As it turned out we could not have picked a better hotel to stay in. Our room (room 2) was spacious, clean and well equiped and fortunately not overlooking the main road so nice and quiet as well. Electric panel radiator in bedroom meant we could have the heating on when we wanted it, not when the hotel dictated it, which was very pleasant at this time of year. Bathroom was adequately furnished with a shower much better than the one we've got at home. As previously mentioned in a review there is a book in the bedroom (The Importance of Milton Ernest) written by a local man which tells the history of Milton Ernest and is a fascinating "easy" read covering everything from very early history to witches to the theories surrounding Glen Miller's death.
reviews.title: Happy Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant each night and the food is absolutely superb. Excellent choice, all perfectly cooked and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Welcoming stay at the Queens Head

reviews.text: On exiting the hotel if you turn left you pass some beautiful old cottages and it is just a short drive (or walk) to Milton Ernest Garden Centre which has a lovely cafe (as well as a good choice of plants and gifts).
reviews.title: Warm, Welcome & Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our trip was a visit to Bletchley Park. Absolutely fascinating and we spent a good 5 hours there. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: You will find a warm welcome here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bev, the manageress, runs a very friendly, efficient hotel and all staff welcome you as friends rather than guests. Lovely lady also helping Bev out. Bev said when we departed that she hoped she would see us again soon and we certainly hope that we will have the opportunity to return in the not too distant future.
reviews.title: Will definitely return

reviews.text: In contrast to the earlier reviewer, I had a completely different and friendly experience. I checked in, explaining that I may not be back from work before the restaurant closed. Jamie offered to have the chef prepare something for my room, if I was late. I arrived back at 10:30pm, 1 minute from getting to my room, Jamie called to say my food was available, she met me in the bar and ensured I was able to get a couple of pints of their excellent Speckeld Hen. Even though she was clearly busy tidying p for the night, she had time to chat and make me feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Fabulous Friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the morning, Bev showed exactly the same level of friendliness and interest. Chatting while she served an excellent breakfast, she made sure I was 100% happy with my stay. I had spent the preious week stopping at various UK hotels including a Hilton. None came close to the my stay at the Queens Head.
reviews.title: Was ok , but woulndn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived a little early, 1.30 with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary . Was told quite sternly that our room wasn't ready yet and that we would have to wait. I said not a problem we will have a drink in the bar, to which I was told that we couldn't as it was only for people that where having lunch there. I said not a problem we will sit outside in the patio area, to which I was told that she hopes I don't smoke as it's no smoking out there . Even though we where the only ones out there I said not a problem my husband will smoke in the car park. She then said that she would let us know when our room was ready. ( check in time 2.00pm) at 2.30 still no sign of anyone so I went to reception which was unattended. When I finally saw the lady she said she had forgotten all about us. On a up note the room was clean enough and the dinner and breakfast was ok, nothing to write home about. On the down side again we booked a table for dinner and they said that we didn't book it and at breakfast they forgot the tea that I had ordered .
reviews.title: wedding anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: highly recomened very friendly,very fast sevice, food fantastic plenty to choose from,will be useing this hotel again 100%.
reviews.title: great little hotel
